chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: Ring
V: ModuleSpace K

Goal:
forall (a : K) (u : nat -> V) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun k : nat => scal a (u k)) n m = scal a (sum_n_m u n m)

Premises:
scal = ModuleSpace.scal K (AbelianGroup.Pack V (ModuleSpace.class K V) V) (ModuleSpace.class K V) : K -> V -> V
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
sum_n_m = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n m : nat) => iter_nat plus zero a n m : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
Notation ModuleSpace := ModuleSpace.type
sum_n_m_mult_l : forall (a : ?K) (u : nat -> ?K) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun k : nat => mult a (u k)) n m = mult a (sum_n_m u n m) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
sum_n_m_mult_r : forall (a : ?K) (u : nat -> ?K) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun k : nat => mult (u k) a) n m = mult (sum_n_m u n m) a where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
sum_n_m_plus : forall (u v : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun k : nat => plus (u k) (v k)) n m = plus (sum_n_m u n m) (sum_n_m v n m) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_mult_l : forall (a : ?K) (u : nat -> ?K) (n : nat), sum_n (fun k : nat => mult a (u k)) n = mult a (sum_n u n) where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
sum_n_mult_r : forall (a : ?K) (u : nat -> ?K) (n : nat), sum_n (fun k : nat => mult (u k) a) n = mult (sum_n u n) a where ?K : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Ring]
sum_n_m_Chasles : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n m k : nat), (n <= S m)%nat -> (m <= k)%nat -> sum_n_m a n k = plus (sum_n_m a n m) (sum_n_m a (S m) k) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_plus : forall (u v : nat -> ?G) (n : nat), sum_n (fun k : nat => plus (u k) (v k)) n = plus (sum_n u n) (sum_n v n) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_m_ext_loc : forall (a b : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (forall k : nat, (n <= k <= m)%nat -> a k = b k) -> sum_n_m a n m = sum_n_m b n m where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_m_S : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), sum_n_m (fun n0 : nat => a (S n0)) n m = sum_n_m a (S n) (S m) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_Sn_m : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (n <= m)%nat -> sum_n_m a n m = plus (a n) (sum_n_m a (S n) m) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_Sm : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (n <= S m)%nat -> sum_n_m a n (S m) = plus (sum_n_m a n m) (a (S m)) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_switch : forall (u : nat -> nat -> ?G) (m n : nat), sum_n (fun i : nat => sum_n (u i) n) m = sum_n (fun j : nat => sum_n (fun i : nat => u i j) m) n where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_m_ext : forall (a b : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (forall n0 : nat, a n0 = b n0) -> sum_n_m a n m = sum_n_m b n m where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_n : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n : nat), sum_n_m a n n = a n where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_m_zero : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (m < n)%nat -> sum_n_m a n m = zero where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_m_sum_n : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n m : nat), (n <= m)%nat -> sum_n_m a (S n) m = minus (sum_n a m) (sum_n a n) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
iter_nat_ext_loc : forall (op : ?T -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T) (a b : nat -> ?T) (n m : nat), (forall k : nat, (n <= k <= m)%nat -> a k = b k) -> iter_nat op x0 a n m = iter_nat op x0 b n m where ?T : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Type]
ModuleSpace.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (scal : K -> V -> V), (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u) -> (forall u : V, scal one u = u) -> (forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v)) -> (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u)) -> ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V
scal_assoc : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u
Record mixin_of (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) : Type := Mixin { scal : K -> V -> V; ax1 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u; ax2 : forall u : V, scal one u = u; ax3 : forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v); ax4 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u) } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
iter_nat_S : forall (op : ?T -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T) (a : nat -> ?T) (n m : nat), iter_nat op x0 (fun n0 : nat => a (S n0)) n m = iter_nat op x0 a (S n) (S m) where ?T : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Type]
scal_opp_l : forall (x : K) (u : V), scal (opp x) u = opp (scal x u)
scal_minus_distr_l : forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (minus u v) = minus (scal x u) (scal x v)
scal_distr_r : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u)
scal_minus_distr_r : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (minus x y) u = minus (scal x u) (scal y u)
scal_distr_l : forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v)
sum_n_m_const_zero : forall n m : nat, sum_n_m (fun _ : nat => zero) n m = zero where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_Sn : forall (a : nat -> ?G) (n : nat), sum_n a (S n) = plus (sum_n a n) (a (S n)) where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
sum_n_ext_loc : forall (a b : nat -> ?G) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, (n <= N)%nat -> a n = b n) -> sum_n a N = sum_n b N where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
scal_opp_r : forall (x : K) (u : V), scal x (opp u) = opp (scal x u)
iter_nat_point : forall (op : ?T -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T), (forall x : ?T, op x x0 = x) -> forall (a : nat -> ?T) (n : nat), iter_nat op x0 a n n = a n where ?T : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Type]
sum_n_ext : forall (a b : nat -> ?G) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, a n = b n) -> sum_n a N = sum_n b N where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]
iter_nat_Chasles : forall (op : ?T -> ?T -> ?T) (x0 : ?T), (forall x : ?T, op x0 x = x) -> (forall x y z : ?T, op x (op y z) = op (op x y) z) -> forall (a : nat -> ?T) (n m k : nat), (n <= S m)%nat -> (m <= k)%nat -> iter_nat op x0 a n k = op (iter_nat op x0 a n m) (iter_nat op x0 a (S m) k) where ?T : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- Type]
ModuleSpace.ax2 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m one u = u
ModuleSpace.ax1 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x y : K) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m x (ModuleSpace.scal K V m y u) = ModuleSpace.scal K V m (mult x y) u
sum_n = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (a : nat -> G) (n : nat) => sum_n_m a 0 n : forall G : AbelianGroup, (nat -> G) -> nat -> G Argument G is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ function_scope nat_scope]
ModuleSpace.ax3 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x : K) (u v : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m x (plus u v) = plus (ModuleSpace.scal K V m x u) (ModuleSpace.scal K V m x v)
ModuleSpace.ax4 : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (m : ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V) (x y : K) (u : V), ModuleSpace.scal K V m (plus x y) u = plus (ModuleSpace.scal K V m x u) (ModuleSpace.scal K V m y u)
scal_one : forall u : V, scal one u = u
sum_O : forall a : nat -> ?G, sum_n a 0 = a 0%nat where ?G : [K : Ring V : ModuleSpace K |- AbelianGroup]

```coq
intros K V a u n m.
unfold sum_n_m.
rewrite sum_n_m_mult_l.
apply scal_assoc.
Qed.```
